description:
International recording artist, KB and respected writer and influencer, Ameen Hudson are best friends from the crazy streets of south side St. Petersburg, FL and share a distinct love for Jesus and for culture. 

Join them as they discuss important conversations on art, theology and Christian living from a unique perspective. 

You’ll never know what type of social commentary you’ll get from these dudes and their guests but we guarantee it to be full of substance, truth and “free smoke” for any controversy.

The Southside Rabbi podcast is presented by Native North.

items.content: Southside Tribe! We are back this week with another heavy hitter! Today we have Wes (aka WesWriter), one half of the musical powerhouse WEARETHEGOOD, and a major creative force behind the scenes in KB's own artistic endeavors over the past several years. Rock with us as we hear Wes's testimony, how he met KB and Ameen, God's heart for the creative arts, Exodus 31 and so much more!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! We are back with a sneak uppercut from the depths! This week we have our longtime friend, stylist, fashion designer, entrepreneur extraordinaire and biblical scholar, Caresse. Just one word, like Oprah. Join us and witness the grace that has been bestowed upon her life, her heart for those around her and her thriving thrifting business. We discuss our dependence on the Lord, the ease of just saying what you believe, and get insight into Dangerous Joy. We expound on the God of the Bible, the Greatest Designer, including how He enjoys his own creation, as it were, "singing about it", and how we are representations of that creative agency right here in His world. Pull up!

Contact Caresse here:
IG: http://instagram.com/revival.atl
Website: https://caressedionne.com

items.content:
Southside Tribe!! We got some strong heavy hitters for ya today!! We got our guy Benjamin Watson back on the show and he brought Elizabeth Graham, both partners in the organization, Stand For Life. This collective educates and equips women and families on what being holistically pro-life is all about, works to bring down blockers to women keeping their pre-born children, and teaches on the image of God on every person, no matter their age or background. They are also releasing an upcoming curriculum for educators and churches alike titled, "What Is A Person?", available May 15th at standforlife.com. Come thru!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! We are back with Part 2 of Dangerous Justice, which is really an ongoing conversation we will be injecting throughout our episodes every now and again.  This time we are unpacking the virtue of Social Holiness, coined by John Wesley in regards to social justice in the Scriptures. We dive into the context of Micah 6, Matthew 25, and Job 31, where guidelines for the believer's love for neighbor in society are laid out. We also touch on the "new man" in Ephesians 2, ask the question, "who are the vulnerable among us?", and talk a bit on how God been God'ing out here! Come thru!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, we back with another fantastic one for ya! Here we chat with our longtime friend and brother in Christ, Rafael Amador, who has a heart for Jesus, justice, discipleship, and the arts. We cover alot of ground here, from studying at a conservative seminary, to believers who deal with same-sex attraction and long to be faithful to Christ, to Jesus' own masculinity in his cultural context, and the idolization of marriage in the modern Church. All that and much more! Slide thru!

items.content:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome back to the Dangerous Jesus series! This week on Southside Rabbi, Dangerous Justice is up to bat, and it's a spicy one! Here we discuss complicated truths, uncomfortable realities, and diversified experiences. We address the elephant in the room of "segregated" worship spaces, as well as God's vision for the Church. We ask the questions, "is ignorance really bliss?", and "how close are allegiance and worship?". We also talk on Gen Z and Jesus, and Ameen gives a great breakdown of how fear drives culture wars. Pull up!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

Southside Tribe!! This is the moment sooo many of you have been waiting for! We finally got our big bro Lecrae to slide thru the pod! We discuss so much from the CC4 Tour, to failure and humility, healthy deconstruction and reconstruction, and the polarized realities we are told we need to fit into. items.title: Season 5 Episode 13: "Artist Highlight: Humility and Failure with Lecrae"

items.content:
What's good family!?! We are back with another installment in our "Dangerous Jesus" series (thank you to all who pre-ordered, shared and supported!!), surveying Chapter 3: Dangerous Gospel. Inside, we discuss the similarities between the Gospel and Geico, asking the question, is your gospel "good news" enough to compensate for the bitter "bad news" of the present? We also address what the good news was according to Jesus himself, and how the body of Christ and the Church should be a foretaste of the kingdom of God. We hear a story from the past of a gospel "lay-up" from KB, and Ameen shares thoughts on the popular retort "just shut up and preach the gospel", when issues of society and diversity are brought up. Hold on to your butts.

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!! 
Become a Patreon member for Early Access & Exclusive Content - https://patreon.com/Southsiderabbi

items.contentSnippet:
What's good family!?! We are back with another installment in our "Dangerous Jesus" series (thank you to all who pre-ordered, shared and supported!!), surveying Chapter 3: Dangerous Gospel. Inside, we discuss the similarities between the Gospel and Geico, asking the question, is your gospel "good news" enough to compensate for the bitter "bad news" of the present? We also address what the good news was according to Jesus himself, and how the body of Christ and the Church should be a foretaste of the kingdom of God. We hear a story from the past of a gospel "lay-up" from KB, and Ameen shares thoughts on the popular retort "just shut up and preach the gospel", when issues of society and diversity are brought up. Hold on to your butts.

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, we are "baik" with another episode in our Dangerous Jesus series, this time touching on Dangerous Faith. We discuss righteousness over rhetoric, as many are unfortunately satisfied with good-talking, rather than good-living. We spend a good minute in 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 and it's context, as well as how to discern the spiritual "giants" among us. KB also shares the story of his mission trip to Liberia, and we get a hilarious lesson in the slang of Southside St. Pete! Come thru!

What's good, family?! This week we are coming in hot and starting a new series diving into some of the chapters and themes of KB's debut book, 'Dangerous Jesus', available everywhere March 7th!! We touch on the heart and intention behind the book and the title, the two types of "PR" in Christianity, and share thoughts on the phenomenon of the chapel service turned 11-day crusade at Asbury University in Kentucky. Pull up, and be sure to pre-order 'Dangerous Jesus'!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! We are back with a discussion on the troubling, unnecessary killing of another unarmed man, Tyre Nichols. You most likely have seen some news coverage of this tragic event, and as the story develops and unfolds, we at Southside Rabbi give some initial thoughts on the situation. We also dive into the history of policing in America, as well as some police reform examples and ideas. We touch on Romans 13, and the biblical call of local governing officials, and even hear the hearts of several police officers/detectives that KB knows personally. Strap in!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, we are back in the building this week with another controversial one for ya: why are so many people leaving the church, and in some cases Jesus himself? We do not claim to have all the answers, but by God's grace, we wade through the dense waters of this topic, from sources with articles and polls, personal experiences, and words from the mouths of others. We look at the book of James, talk inspiration vs. transformation, how we use our tongues, to all-out hypocrisy. If you or someone you know have left the Church for one reason or another, we implore you to be blessed by this episode. Hold onto your butts!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe!! We are back with another hot one! This time our guy Scootie Wop joins us for some commentary on reconciliation, which includes healing AND forgiveness. We open with a few laughs (as usual) then move into deeper discussion on biblical forgiveness, and why we shouldn't cheapen it. We also take a look at Jesus' own words on forgiveness, and what it cost Him to earn our deliverance. We close with a glimpse into a time where Ameen and KB were not on good terms, and had to overcome it. If you've ever been hurt by, or have yourself hurt someone, you need to hear this. Pull up!

items.content: What's good, family?! Have you ever known anyone who suspected you might be an alien in disguise? Or swore up and down that the Earth is shaped like a frisbee? How about thinking Hillary is the Anti-Christ?! We are back with Part 2 of this very polarizing topic of conspiracy theories - approaching it biblically, culturally, and as always, hilariously! We knew we had to bring this topic back from Season 2, as conspiracies have been with us literally from the beginning, and they are not going anywhere, anytime soon. We discuss how to approach information, how to spot the difference between fact and opinion, and how to love those you know who may be drinking down conspiracies like water. Hold on to your butts!

KB shares the inside scoop on the birthday roast of Trip Lee a few years back, and the path to wholeness. Come rock with us!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, we back with another hitter! This week we are discussing something that troubles all of us one way or another: sin! We talk on root causes, spiritual therapy, taking action against sin early, and bringing our weaknesses TO God, rather than trying to keep them from Him. We also touch on Dane Ortlund's excellent book, Gentle and Lowly, that shows how the main disposition we see of Jesus in Scripture is that of a sympathizer and lover of the weak, the broken, the oppressed, the forgotten, and the sinner. Y'all please tell Dane he needs to come to the show! In addition to all that, this has to be the single most epic, legendary intro we have ever done! Hold on to your butts!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! Season 5 continues with another fantastic people for you! This week we have the industrious Ty Brasel, one of the hardest working CHH artists out there. Here we touch on the heart behind Ty's new album, his testimony, and overcoming adversity. KB shares how fighting through pain can be a catalyst for growth, and Ameen touches on remembering God's faithful promises whether in the midst of tribulations or abundance. We also have a special surprise for those watching the video: a sneak peek of Ty's 'HGA Sessions' performance, showcasing his new song, "ON THE RUN". Come witness the #BraselDazzle !!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! The wait is over! We are back in action with Season 5 on deck, and this episode is one for the ages! It's been a few months, so with all that's going on in the world, we circle back to the rise of Christian nationalism, the recent antics of Kanye West, and the Hebrew Israelite community. One central question we seek to pose to our listeners here, with everything you are doing, teaching, subscribing to, loving, or hating, lifting up, or silencing: Who are you becoming? In other words, what fruit is your life producing? Beatitudes or belligerence? Hold onto your butts!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Y'all done up and done it! With Season 4 over with, we were out here resting, loving God and neighbor, gearing up for Season 5, when we got hit with the landmark news that the Supreme Court ruled Roe v. Wade overturned. Since then, we have received countless comments and DM's asking us to come down from the mountaintop, and address the people. Jokes aside, we are here with a special edition episode to give our takes, hot and cool, hoping to expand the vision of what pro-life really means, calling all of our listeners, whatever "side" of the decision you are on, to produce the fruit of the Spirit of God in your responses. We hope to encourage and prepare our churches for the work and effort that this decision actually entails. Let's get it!!

Full episode on all audio platforms, bonus content on our Patreon community!! 
Become a Patreon member for Early Access & Exclusive Content - https://patreon.com/Southsiderabbi

We move from discussing the good theology of Job's friends, to the age-old question, "How do I actually know and feel that God loves me?", to emotional intelligence in the Church and in this world full of hardship. Y'all pull up and get comfortable!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, what up?! We got a fantastic people for you this week! Our brother David French carved out some time to chat with us about the Christian call to justice and mercy, as well as sharing and breaking down one of his favorite passages of Scripture with us. We discuss the discrepancy between the early Christian Church's approach to engaging society as opposed to the nationalism and thirst for political power we see in today's times. Ameen also shares a story regarding his selection for the 2016 presidential candidate!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, y'all better stretch before listening to this joint! This week we have 2/3 of our sisters from the Truth's Table Podcast with us to discuss and breakdown some of their brand new debut book! And break it down they did! Dr. Christina Edmondson and Ms. Ekemini Uwan literally encouraged our souls by sharing their takes and burdens on colorism, anti-racism, forgiveness, singleness and marriage, misogyny, and biblical theology. In other words, there's something for errbody in here!! Their book releases April 26th, 2022, available at all major retailers, now available for pre-order. This episode is a must-hear! Hold onto your butts!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!! 
Become a Patreon member for Early Access & Exclusive Content - https://patreon.com/Southsiderabbi

items.title: Season 4 Episode 8: "Muse On: A Seat At Truth's Table"

items.content:
Southside Tribe, salute!! We are back this week with one of the biggest stories in recent times: the incident between Chris Rock, Will Smith and Jada Pinkett at the 2022 Oscars. We keep it real, raw and nuanced as we navigate this situation from seemingly every angle imaginable. From what the Scriptures have to say (in context), to what would have proved better in the situation, to the real injuries that words can cause, and even the reality of women who struggle with various conditions and vulnerabilities. This is def one for the books! Bonus content from this episode available for our Patreon subscribers! Swing thru!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, what's good?! We are back with KB's "favorite episode this season", discussing the recent documentary covering the rise and falls of Kanye West, Jeen-yuhs. We dive into the Scriptures on several topics from suffering and daily encouragement, to success and God's grace! Ameen breaks down the trials Job encountered by God's hand, and ways Satan tries to tempt believers. KB also gives us insight on some ways fame and money can corrupt our hearts, if we allow them to rule over us, and shares a hilarious story, with a valuable lesson, about a traveling ritual he has with his sons. Pull all the way up!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Ayye, Southside Tribe! We are back with another one! This week we are tackling a prevalent issue in the culture: the 'manoshpere', and 'manly man' ideology, especially as it relates to pride and degrading women, and seeing this through the lens of Scripture. We address the "alpha/beta male" mentality and speak on some of the roots of these terms. Come rock with us and hear what kind of servant leadership Christ Jesus modeled for us who follow Him!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Hey family! This week the hits keep coming! After our illustrious intros, we acknowledge and briefly summarize the conflict in Ukraine, and segue into a discussion about burnout, for pastors, believers in Christ, and those still seeking Him. We also discuss the command from Jesus to not be alarmed, or anxious at the troubling times we see all around us. KB also shares a recent time he was close to burning out, as well as 3 practices Lecrae shared with him on the importance of rest. Stay tuned for a special surprise at the end!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are back with a look back at our testimonies in how the Lord God showed himself strong in our lives early on, and brought us towards His marvelous light! We also revisit a few topics we have discussed in the recent past including social justice, deconstruction, CRT, American history and the spreading of the Gospel to the Western world. This is one for the books! Pull up!

items.content:
Southside Tribe!! We are back with another haymaker, speaking on dear brothers and sisters leaving their faith in Christ. We first touched on this topic back in Episode 9 of Season 1, and have revisited in light if recent events. There have been a slew of people, local and public figures, who have believed their doubts, taken their leave and left many around them full of questions. Most of y'all know that one of our mantras is "no easy answers", so with that being said, we sit and discuss the nuances of this difficult topic. God has not promised us "all the answers" to life's most difficult questions, here or in eternity. We apologize in advance for the audio! Come rock with us!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe!! Welcome to Season 4! Thank y'all so much for rocking with us! We are back with a weighty and solemn conversation as we wade in the waters of the recent situation with a brother in the Lord, involving infidelity. As we pray for honesty of the heart and seek reconciliation for him and his spouse, we also see the opportunity to use our voices for exploited women everywhere, especially those of the household of faith. We discuss valuing and strengthening our sisters, as well as how the Bible shows us God's heart for women and wives. Click play and buckle up!

items.content:
Southside Tribe! We are still here! This week we are continuing the convo with big bro Ambassador, which was so weighty it deserved a second episode! Here we discuss some circumstances and mindsets that may have moved some of our dear friends and peers to the controversial belief system of 'Hebrew Israelism', more commonly heard as 'Black Hebrew Israelism', even people in our extended community. Here we discuss the Scriptures handed to us by the Apostles pertaining to God's love, ethnicity vs. circumcision of the heart, and the 'wall of hostility' that Christ Jesus has torn down by His work. Lots of y'all have been asking for this joint, so hold onto your butts for this incredible end to Season 3! Here's to 2022!!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Yo, Southside Tribe! This week we got a 'fantastic people' for you! Yes, you read that right! We have our big bro William "The Ambassador" Branch, one of the most prominent founders of Cross Movement, and the Christian Hip Hop movement, in general! Here we salute our brother, who has discipled us and so many of our peers from a distance, and we catch up on his current position as Professor of Preaching and Bible at SEBTS, and prison ministry. We also get into the convo about the current state of Christian Hip Hop and where things may have shifted artistically, and KB asks the question, "Was Cross Movement unfaithful to and silent about the Social Justice conversation?" Strap in and hold on for Part one of this ride with Amba! Just in time for Christmas!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!! 
Become a Patreon member for Early Access & Exclusive Content - https://patreon.com/Southsiderabbi

items.content:
What's good, family?! This week we are back with a look at vigilantism, particularly in reference to the recent Rittenhouse and Arbery verdicts. KB shares several stories of personal experience, leading with the question: is it ego or is it danger, as the trend continues of civilians taking matters into their own hands, even after being instructed by professionals not to intervene. We also ask the question: in what ways should followers of Christ look different than the world in exercising our 2nd Amendment rights? Join us for this tough, nuanced conversation!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are continuing mourning the recent death of fashion designer Virgil Abloh, and reflecting on eternity, asking the question: what does it really mean to gain the world, and lose your soul? We dive into the long-debated dichotomy of faith and works, discussing if they are really enemies, we touch on the work of disciplining your heart against default reactions that may not be godly. This is a rich one, y'all strap in!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

Big bro Ruslan recently visited and sat with Ameen to discuss the "House of the Ritten" situation, as well as 2nd Amendment, NRA, and armed self-defense. Some of you may have seen this on Ruslan's channel already, but we put the "Southside stank" on it and have it here on our channel as well!! What's good, Southside Tribe! This week we've got the dynamic author, speaker and recording artist Maddie Rey! We know the presence of our godly and gifted sisters has been lacking our show, and there are many more to come! Here we discuss Maddie's background and upbringing in her father's church, the origins of her music career, and some of the pressures and expectations of being a woman in an often male-dominated space. Maddie also shares her thoughts on dating and church membership, don't miss it!

What's good, family?! This week we are back with our 'first real pastor', Tommy Kyllonen of Crossover Church in Tampa! Here we catch up and tell some great stories, and get into some keys for long-lasting ministry, finding new and creative ways to love and serve our local communities, and get into why the "social justice" conversation has not caused an uproar at Pastor T's church, even with the diverse cultures and traditions represented in the congregation.

Get the Love Our City Kit FREE with the purchase of 10 books at www.LoveOurCityBook.com

Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are bringing to y'all, for the second time, the entrepreneur extraordinaire, big bro Ruslan! We're discussing some of the pitfalls of social media, loving our neighbors, and some of the outrage surrounding the recent Netflix special featuring comedian Dave Chappelle. We ask the question, what is the institution of the comedian really for? KB and Ameen answer that and more, plus Ruslan gives the benediction, blessing the podcast and our work for the Lord and the community! Let's get it!

items.content:
What's going on, family?! This week we sit down with the legendary Dr. Eric Mason. Y'all better strap in and hold onto your butts for this one! Here we talk with Dr. Mason about the origins of "deconstruction", or renovating faith, that has recently become a prevalent topic in Christian communities, especially in America. KB illustrates the importance of trusting God's promises and goodness, and Dr. Mason shows us where and how the first deconstruction happened in the Bible.

items.content:
What up, family?! We are back on with our bro Flizzy-Flame, and this time we are discussing Kanye's latest album, Donda, the grace of God expressed in different art forms, as well as God's creation. KB also shares the story of his first time hearing "Grenade" from Bruno Mars, Ameen explains how conversions to Christ are not always "neat and buttoned up", and Flame talks on how this is God's world, much bigger than any of our black and white categories of "sacred/secular". Buckle up and rock with us!

Full episode on all audio platforms, and full video on our Patreon community!!

items.content:
What up, Southside Tribe!? This week we sit down with our brother Alex Castaneda, a Cuban rapper, activist, and follower of Christ. We discuss the past and present sociopolitical plight of the island of Cuba, as well as the story of Emelina Nunez, which Alex's last album was about. We touch on the arts, faith, culture, as well as recent comments from a particular group about an "embargo". Come rock with us as we seek to bear the burdens of our brothers and sisters, and be a voice for the voiceless!

Hear Alex's album here: https://music.apple.com/us/album/a-prisoner-in-paradise-2-the-story-of-emelina/1539244221

What up, Southside Tribe!! We are officially back with Season 3, and this time we have the legendary master minstrel himself, Mr. Montell Jordan! Montell gives us an inside look at his origins in the music industry, his "churched" background, as well as his powerful testimony of how the Lord moved him to live for God's glory. Montell also gives us a masterclass in reconciliation regarding his strained marriage, plus KB shares a special connection he has with Montell from the past! Turn this up in your big black truck and roll with us!

items.title: Season 2: Episode 19 "A Conversation with Flame"

items.content: Southside Tribe, y'all better buckle up for this one! This time around, we caught up with our guy, Dr. Neil Shenvi, aka Big Daddy Neil, aka The Muffin Man, and had a lively discussion about reconciliation, the gospel of Christ, concerns about CRT, and how some people use Dr. Shenvi's work as a weapon! As some of you may know, Dr. Shenvi is a figurehead praised (and not praised) by many in evangelical circles, and there are some ideas we challenge each other on via social media. This session was recorded in August 2020, and was originally intended as exclusive content for our patrons, but we've decided to release it as a 'bonus' episode for our extended audience. Enjoy!

items.title: Season 2: Patreon-Exclusive Bonus: "The Seed of Every Sin"

items.content: Yo, Southside Tribe! Welcome to the next episode of our CRT to the glory of God series! First and foremost, thank you all for rocking with us this season as we intend to influence the culture to love God and neighbor better! In this episode, we have the dynamic tag team, Dr. Nathan Cartagena and Bradly Mason back with us to do a full-out masterclass on some primary sources, court cases, defining terms, responses to allegations, and all the while, pushing us to be Christ-like, merciful, and to seek the God of mercy Himself! Pull up Google and hold on tight!

items.title: Season 2: Episode 18: "CRT Series Part Four: Masterclass with Dr. Nathan Cartagena and Bradly Mason"

items.content: What's going on, family?! Welcome back as we continue our series on critical race theory, to the glory of God! This time we are joined by our brother Dr. Nathan Luis Cartagena of Wheaton College, as he parses through some of his experiences as a Puerto Rican and Caucasian man in America, as well as his introduction to CRT. Dr. Cartagena also shares intimate details of his relationship with his Southern grandmother, who was raised and 'discipled ' in the Jim and Jane Crow era, as well as his desire for believers to depend on Holy Spirit to guide and shape us in ways that will make us better lovers of Christ and neighbor. Disclaimer: this is not an apologetic for CRT. We are not proponents of the discipline of Critical Theory, or any of its counterparts. We are defenders of truth, wherever it may be found. Hold on to your butts!!

items.title: Season 2: Episode 17: "CRT Series Part Three: Sanctification in a Racialized World with Dr. Nathan"

items.content: What's going on, family?! This is Part 2 of our series engaging CRT to the glory of God, featuring our brother Bradly Mason, who has actually spoken with and studied several of the founders of CRT, and will prayerfully bring some clarity to this big mess of a "culture war" out here in the streets. Here we discuss much about Voddie Baucham's recent book 'Fault Lines', as well as the many misconceptions equating those thinking and talking about 'social holiness', with walking away from faith in Christ. Bradly also shares an exclusive story about how Ameen helped shape his own change of heart towards these issues years ago! Buckle up!

items.content: Southside Tribe, welcome to our series! If you've had your ear to the street in any regard, you have probably heard the term, Critical Race Theory. There is a recent push by the mainstream American church to demonize anything that concerns racism, white supremacy, or diversity, by calling it "CRT". And in doing so, they are grossly misrepresenting (in some cases, outright lying on) the scholars who originated the discipline. The purpose of this series is namely to inform the confused, and equip allies who see and understand Jesus' heart for the marginalized and oppressed in any society. Disclaimer: this is not an apologetic for CRT. We are not proponents of the discipline of Critical Theory, or any of its counterparts. We are defenders of truth, wherever it may be found. We are joined by brother Isaiah Thompson from Rapzilla for this first convo! Come rock with us!!

items.content: What's going on, family?! We recently had a dope convo with our bro, Ruslan, the Armenian entrepreneur and rapper, who is a Christian, and also a Christian rapper (y'all should get that). He even canceled his meeting with Trump to meet with us! We discuss some of the 'hot takes' from Ruslan's own podcast, the wisdom that Jesus taught, the Christian hip-hop movement: its recent history and new trajectory. So come rock with us, and then go run up "Church Clap"!!

items.content: Southside Tribe! The hits just keep coming, as we continue this season with Satanic Panic! We begin with the recent super-controversial release of Lil Nas X's music video and sneaker, that were "laced" with abundant, sensational demonic imagery. We move on to answer the oft-asked question, "What's up with the skull?!", and tackle superstition, how to get wisdom, Galatians Chap 5, and the real mission of Satan. Grab your bible and press play!

What up, family?! In this episode, we sit down with author and professor, Dr. Esau McCaulley!
We had an encouraging and hilarious time discussing his book "Reading While Black", as well as touching on God's Word, the experience of Jesus on Earth, social location, and many aspects detailed in the book. So cook you up some grits (however you like it), hit the play button and rock with us!

items.content:
What up, family?! We had an absolute blast catching up with our brother Tedashii recently. In this episode, we discuss the tragic loss of Tedashii's son Chase, the ongoing healing process, as well as the triumphs that have blossomed from this new-normal. We also touch on some of the pitfalls of the Christian music industry, dive in to God's Word, and the ambience of social media. Even so, the laughs and the soundboard are almost non-stop!
Come rock with us!

items.content: What's up, family?! We have some important questions to discuss this episode! Namely, has the civic religion of American Christianity become a worthless replica of the original? Does the Big Bicep Curling Machine really give you Schwarzenegger-sized biceps in 15 minutes? Is the English language superior to Spanish? Does "success cover a multitude of sins?" Rock with us and dig through the Scriptures to find out!

items.content:
What's up, family! Hold onto your butts as we debrief the aftermath of this wild and controversial election season, fraught with everything from political gang banging to voter fraud conspiracies. Pastor Sho 'N Go gives an overview of the State of the Union, KB has some sobering words for "cancel culture", and we address Romans 13 in honoring and praying for our elected leaders. Ameen closes with a heartfelt prayer that helps point the true believer to the Lord of all, as we keep it moving, as a nation and a people. 

Disclaimer: We, on Southside Rabbi, did not endorse or vote for either candidate.

items.content: What up, family?! This time around we have a very special guest for you! Our good brother Phanatik, aka Brady Goodwin Jr. joins us for some catch-up and conversation surrounding this crazy year (2020), the origins of CHH as a movement in the early 1990's, and his brief take on the current state of the American church. Brady is a founding member of the legendary, two time Grammy-nominated Christian rap group Cross Movement, author and college professor. You don't want to miss this!

items.content: What's going on, family! Continue holding onto your butts as we delve a bit further into the hot topics of politics in the life of believers, the inception of the "Evangelical" voting block, and abortion. In this upcoming election season, we want to continue to equip our listeners with the mind of Christ, who literally said, "My Kingdom is not of this world". So as we survey the landscape of our nation and engage numerous circles, let us see through the eyes of Jesus, and not simply a political stance. As always, thank you for rocking with us!

items.content: Hold on to your butts! This might be a bumpy one! In this episode, we are discussing issues surrounding diversity and how we as Christians should approach it in our country, even though some people may believe it is "un-American." We briefly touch on the killings of several unarmed people of color earlier this year, as well as the BLM organization and a short history of racism and colorism in the world at large. But with all that said, don't forget to check out eZReaderBible.com!! 😉

items.content: Are you or someone you know in danger of shipwrecked faith? Have our churches been infected with the "imma do me" mentality? The post-modern philosophies of our time have bled into many hearts in the Church, and we have recently seen many Christ-followers "turn back" in the name of "deconstruction" or exploring a different spiritual journey. KB and Ameen take the Word of God to this issue and keep it funky like always. Join us as we break down this unfortunate and all too common phenomenon.

items.content:
What would you say to the person guilty of murdering your brother? Would you seek vengeance or forgiveness? 

This week the nation was stunned by a remarkable display of the Gospel of grace. In this episode, KB and Ameen Hudson candidly unpack the history of the African American witness in the face of oppression and whether or not forgiveness undermines the pursuit and fight for justice.

items.content: In this episode KB and Ameen look at the future of Christian Hip-hop and discuss the state of the genre. They also talk about the impact of Kanye West, the history of Contemporary Christian Music and how movements originate and persevere.

items.content: In this debut episode, Ameen and KB discuss insights they gathered from Matthew McCullough’s recent book, “Remember Death: The Surprising Path to Living Hope”. Specifically, they converse about society’s denial of life’s finiteness, a scriptural perspective eternity, and a deconstruction of Joyner Lucas.
